title.narrative: Kvinnligt ledarskap och medborgarinflytande på lokal nivå IDEA
Women Leadership and CItizen Participation at the Local Level IDEA

description.narrative: Bidraget syftar till att förbättra kvaliteten av kvinnors politiska deltagande i de nio nyligen bildade bolivianska autonoma regeringarna. Kvinnliga ledare som arbetar i de regionala regeringarna kommer att få särskild teknisk assistans för att stärka sina personliga färdigheter för att ytterligare förbättra sina beslutsprocesser.

IDEA has applied to Sida for a funding of 19 million SEK to carry out the "Women leadership and Citizen participation at local level" in the nine Bolivian departments/regions, during the period October 2016 - March 2019.
This proposed initiative is aimed to improve the quality of women’s political participation in the nine departmental governments, so they will contribute with a more accountable, efficient and solid public management in their respective local governments.

The intervention was intended to provide the beneficiaries, mainlywomen and the youth, with technical assistance to improve their personal skills and to increase the quality of their political participation in the design, promotion and implementation of public policies in their respective regions. The intervention had the following four outcome objectives: 1. A more efficient and improved public management at regional levels, including higher citizen participation, in the targeted Bolivian regions has been achieved. 2. Women working in the regional governments promote public policies in their respective areas of work. 3. Construction and implementation of the "agenda from the young people" in the targeted regions of the country. 4. The Bolivian Electoral Body obtains the international certification ISO 9000 as a proof of an improved and trustable management system.

participating-org.narrative: International IDEA/International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance
International IDEA/International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The achieved results according to the objectives stated above can be summarized as follows:1. Thirteen different public policies at regional levels were proposed and approved in Beni, Cochabamba, La Paz, Santa Cruz and Tarija which were defined as the target Bolivian regions of the contribution under objective 1. These policies/regulations are applied/used in the regions of origin. For example, the Regional Strategy to eradicate violence against women was approved and issued in Cochabamba, as it was the case of the Regulation on public hearings and citizen participation issued by the regional government in Beni. 2. Chuquisaca, apart from Cochabamba, Santa Cruz and Tarija, were selected as target regions under objective 2. There are at least 25 women's organizations in each of the four regions which have been active to discuss and propose public policies to their corresponding regional governments once the called "Political Agenda from the Women" was updated(*). Also, more than 310 elected women in their regional assemblies (regional or local authorities) were provided with technical assistance in legislative management including a gender perspective. (*) The initial "Political Agenda" was a former result obtained by IDEA and Sweden in a previous contribution. 3. Construction and implementation of the "agenda from the Young people". More than 200 organizations of youngsters were identified in La Paz, Cochabamba, Santa Cruz, Tarija and Beni to start working in integrating their visions and proposals so as to be part of future development agendas in their regions. The corresponding regional governments agreed to enter in this inclusive process. Separate studies/researches were carried out in each region to understand and to know the vision of these millenials. In the end, many of the youngsters who benefited with technical assistance under this initiative are in expectant positions in different public spaces and political parties in their regions. The "Agenda" was fully completed and resulted in some proposals worked by the youngsters (male and female) that were presented -separately- to regional governments in La Paz and Beni, i.e., The Law on the Youth. Approvals of both legal initiatives are expected to occur by 2019. 4. Technical assistance was provided to the Plurinational Electoral Body so as to be prepared to obtain the electoral ISO. A group of experienced consultants on ISO procedures in relation to electoral institutions working in Bolivia set the basis for the Bolivian Body to prepare and present all the documentation needed to get the international certification. Nowadays, the Bolivian Body is still performing its duties on that topic. Also, in the first half of 2018 an international electoral audit was also performed to the Bolivian Electoral Roll and concluded that such roll is 97% trustable.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
